meanings.sent1: The debauched man showed no remorse for his actions.
meanings.sent2: She avoided the debauched company at the party.
meanings.sent3: The debauched behavior of the children shocked the teacher.
meanings.sent4: The once pristine forest now looked debauched after the storm.
meanings.sent5: The debauched city streets were filled with litter and graffiti.

meanings.sent1: The debauched feast was filled with rich, decadent foods.
meanings.sent2: He led a debauched lifestyle, always seeking pleasure.
meanings.sent3: The debauched spa offered luxurious treatments to its clients.
meanings.sent4: The debauched garden was a paradise of exotic flowers and scents.
meanings.sent5: The debauched music festival was a celebration of hedonism and joy.

meanings.definition: To lead away from virtue or excellence
meanings.sent1: He debauched his friend by convincing him to skip class.
meanings.sent2: The charismatic leader debauched the community with false promises.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat debauched the peaceful atmosphere by knocking over vases.
meanings.sent4: The storm debauched the carefully tended garden, destroying all the flowers.
meanings.sent5: The negative influences debauched her once strong moral compass.
